original: Ekman, John Ossian, skådespelare, Göteborg, f. 15/11/80 i Sthlm. G. 1. m. skådcsp. Ella Eufro^syne Wider-crantz, d. 17; 2. m. Ingrid Ohlsson; 3. m. Blenda Berg; 4. m. Karin Hansson. Barn i föreg. äkt.: Boel f. 16, g. m. kapt. i intend likår. Eugen Vei-lerz, Skövde, Per 21, anst. h. Albert Bonnier, Sthlm. — Stud. först t. målare, bl. a. på tekn. sk. f. Olof Arbore-lius samt på Konstn:förb. sk. 97-00, började därefter v. Elin Svenssons teatersk. Debut. h. Ranft på Sv. teatern s. Amandus i Max Halbes Ungdom 0’1, start, efter tre år h. Ranft tills. m. Arne Ekermann försöksteatern Lilla teatern i Folkets Hus konsertsalong, uppf. m. dennas ensemble bl. a. Strindbergs Fröken Julie f. första ggn i Sv:e, anst. h. Knut Lindroth 05-08, h. Anders Frithiof 08-09, h. Allan Ryding 09-10 samt h. Hugo Rönnblad 10-11, fast anst. v. A-B Sv. Biografteatern 11-17, under denna tid tillika knuten t. Skådebanan 11-12, t. Einar Fröberg o. Victor Sjöström 12-13 samt t. Intima teatern 15-18, därefter anst. v. Gbgs stadsteater m. avbrott f. eng. v. Hälsingborgs stadsteater 23-28. Har på scenen framtr. i ett stort ant. klassiska o. a. roller, bl. a. titelroll, i Per Gynt o. Gustaf Vasa, Jago i Othello, Narren i Trettondagsafton, Tokeramo i Taifun, Sang i Över förmåga, Reback i Johan Ulfstjerna, Gert Bokpräntare i Mäster Olof, Claudius i Hamlet, Petruccio i Så tuktas en argbigga, Benedikt i Mycket väsen f. ingenting, Maurice i Brott o. brott, har därjämte medv. i en mängd filmer, t. ex. Berg-Ejvind o. hans hustru, Synnöve Solbakken, Sången om den eldröda blomman, Fredlös. Hobby: målning. RVO.
translated: Ekman, John Ossian, actor, Gothenburg, b. 15/11/80 in Stockholm. Married 1st to actress Ella Eufrosyne Widercrantz, d. 17; 2nd to Ingrid Ohlsson; 3rd to Blenda Berg; and 4th to Karin Hansson. Children from previous marriages: Boel, b. 16, married to a captain in the administrative military service, Eugen Veilerz, Skövde, and Per, 21, employed by Albert Bonnier, Stockholm. John first studied painting at, among others, Olof Arborelius's technical school and the Art Association school from 97-00, before starting at Elin Svensson's drama school. He made his debut at the Swedish Theatre in 1901 as Amandus in Max Halbe's Jugend. After three years at the Swedish Theatre with August Falck and Arne Ekman, John started the experimental theatre at Lilla Teatern in Folkets Hus' concert hall. With this ensemble, he was responsible for several productions, including the first performance of Strindberg's Miss Julie in Sweden. He worked for Knut Lindroth from 05-08, Anders Frithiof from 08-09, Allan Ryding from 09-10, and Hugo Rönnblad from 10-11. He was then permanently employed by AB Svenska Biografteatern 11-17, during which time he was also attached to Skådebanan from 11-12, to Einar Fröberg and Victor Sjöström from 12-13, and to Intima Teatern from 15-18. After that, he worked for the Gothenburg City Theatre with the exception of a brief period at Hälsingborg City Theatre from 23-28. He has appeared on stage in a large number of classical and other roles, including the title role in Peer Gynt and Gustav Vasa, Iago in Othello, the Fool in Twelfth Night, Tokeramo in Taifun, Sang in Beyond Ability, Reback in Johan Ulfstjerna, Gert Bokpräntare in Mäster Olof, Claudius in Hamlet, Petruccio in The Taming of the Shrew, Benedikt in Much Ado About Nothing, and Maurice in Crime and Punishment. In addition, he has appeared in many films, such as The Outlaw and His Wife, Synnöve Solbakken, and The Song of the Scarlet Flower. His hobby is painting. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa.

structured.name: John Ossian Ekman
structured.description: John Ossian Ekman was a Swedish actor born on November 15, 1880 in Stockholm. He was married four times and had two children from previous marriages. Ekman first studied painting before pursuing a career in acting. He made his debut in 1901 at the Swedish Theatre and went on to perform in a variety of classical and modern plays, as well as films. Ekman's hobby was painting. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa.
